captions.text:
This obelisk
is of your hardest stone.

This is part of the weirding way
that we will teach you.

Some thoughts
have a certain sound,

that being the equivalent
to a form.

you will be able to paralyze nerves,
shatter bones,

set fires, suffocate an enemy
or burst his organs.

We will kill until no Harkonnen
breathes Arrakeen air.

[ Inner Voice ]
My name is a killing word.

Yet in order to lead them,
l must conquer the worm.

title: Dune (7/9) Movie CLIP - The Weirding Way (1984) HD

in...﻿

comments.author: Hanno the Phoenician

comments.text:
+Hanno Phoenicia the prequels were written by the Children of Herbert based 
on notes he left behind.  Dune has been filmed 4 times but the very first 
filming never left production since the director's vision was too bizarre.  
The next 2 books have movies I think... though Children of Dune is the only 
one that comes to mind at this time. 
I'm parasitic/symbiotic.  What do you think I mean by Host?
comments.author: Pink Program

comments.text:
What do you mean by "Host"? The original novel Dune had many sequels but no 
prequels done by Frank Herbert.

I was referring to the theatrical movie shown in the video, which had no 
sequels. 

The remake, consisting of two films, was made for TV and done by completely 
different people. It was of high quality.
comments.author: Hanno the Phoenician

comments.text:
I've watched the book and my Host has read every book and chapter including

comments.text:

comments.author: StarDagger777

comments.text:
+Landsknecht 86 depends on what the armor is made of and how much energy 
you have available to generate vibrations.  Anything from making it 
brittle, lighting it on fire, vaporizing it but the real insidiousness of 
sonic weaponry is that it can bypass the armor directly and hit the meat 
underneath ^_^
comments.author: Pink Program

comments.text: +Pink Program Crap, what can that do to body armor?
comments.author: Landsknecht 86

comments.text:
+Yapostadodat This is sonic manipulation and vibration manifestation.  The 
right sounds can create sonoluminous fusion bubbles that can disrupt 
matter, light fires etc etc etc.  Ultrasonic and infrasonic pulses can 
cause vertigo, blindness, organ damage, hallucinations and tigers use an 
infrasonic roar to paralyze prey.  There is nothing mystical or magical 
about it.
comments.author: Pink Program

comments.text:
None of this wacko nonsense is about Eastern Philosophy, you're all just 
new age religion freaks in the US.

comments.author: Kemonokami

comments.text:
I'll speak to this.  Martial arts is VERY much about Eastern religious 
beliefs.  The Yin and Yang, the Five Animals, Qi or Chi, Taoist and 
Buddhist styles, etc. . This whole Weirding Way and The Force from that 
other film are just modern manifestations of the belief in a cosmic energy 
known as Qi.
comments.author: Yapostadodat

comments.text:
It's just martial arts, nothing unique. However, your comment sounds like

comments.author: Kemonokami

comments.text:
The problem with commentary by Brian Herbert is that it's written by Brian 
Herbert. Nothing Brian writes is canon, including commentary on Frank's 
life... not saying it's a bald-faced lie, but likely a generous 
reinterpretation of facts. I imagine as you're a Dune fan you've seen the 
European mini series. Those episodes are a pretty good adaptation of the 
books, I think. Why in the world would Lynch invent new content when he 
already had too much material for a single movie? Seems really odd.
comments.author: DavidSkis

comments.text:
If you read Dreamer of Dune, Herbert's son explains that Frank acknowledged 
the need for screen adaptations. He collaborated with Lynch on the script 
and approved the alterations.

comments.text:
I would go further than that even, with references to Zensunni as a 
religion. Paul's bodyguard call themselves Fedaykin, which is pretty much 
the same as the Islamic warriors called Fedayeen. Paul's mother Jessica is 
called "Sayyadina" by the Fremen. "Sayyida" is an islamic honorific term 
for a woman who is descended from Fatima the daughter of the prophet 
Muhammad.
